title: Rounded san-serif with geometric porportions - like Futura with rounded corners?...
content:
Hello,

I am working on a logo design for a high tech venture which has many geometric circles and I wanted to try and find a sans-serif with rounded corners that would harmonize with the perfect circles in the logo design. I am presenting type treatments in U&lc as well as all caps. I would like the typeface to have a normal width, not too condensed or too expanded.

I was thinking of Bryant or VAG rounded but I thought there might be better faces to match the perfect circles used in the logo design.

Thank you in advance.

Regards, Sal
author: sal_randazzo

comments.content:
Shamelessly I would go with:  
 [http://www.t26.com/fonts/731-Target](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020513/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/731-Target "http://www.t26.com/fonts/731-Target")  
or:  
 [http://www.t26.com/search?q=haaparanta+tar](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020513/http:/www.t26.com/search?q=haaparanta+tar "http://www.t26.com/search?q=haaparanta+tar")  
Target was a headline font for US Playboy cover from 2005 to 2009.

There is a futura rounded by Scangraphic:  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/scangraphic/futura\_round\_sb\_regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020513/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/scangraphic/futura_round_sb_regular/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/scangraphic/futura\_round\_sb\_regular/")  
Maybe this would meet the case?
